subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|プレアデス星団}} {{wp|Pleaides}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|すばる}} Likely from {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=すばる|-}}, use of kanji in Japanese texts first appears in the ''{{w|ja:丹後国風土記|Tangō-no-kuni Fudoki}}'' (''c.'' mid-8th century), phonetic spelling first attested in the ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' (938 {{CE}}). By extension from {{m|ja|統ばる|tr=subaru||to [[bunch]] together; to [[unite]]|pos=intransitive}}, due to the way the [[star]]s in the [[constellation]] all ''[[cluster]]'' together.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} Compare {{m|ja|統べる|tr=suberu||to [[command]]|pos=transitive}}.

Proper noun
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|昴宿}} {{wp|Hairy Head}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ぼう}} {{IPAchar|/bau/}} → {{IPAchar|/bɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/boː/}} From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=ほう|-}} {{ltc-l|昴}}.

subSections.title: Proper noun
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=i|たかし}}
Nominalization of classical adjective {{m|ja|高し|tr=takashi}}, modern {{m|ja|高い|tr=takai||[[high]]}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=i|のぼる}}
Nominalization of verb {{m|ja|[[上る]], [[登る]]|tr=noboru||to [[ascend]], [[rise]]}}.
